definition: n	The atmosphere above a given point, especially as visible from the surface of the Earth as the place where the sun, moon, stars, and clouds are seen.
n	With a descriptive word: the part of the sky which can be seen from a specific place or at a specific time; its climate, condition, etc.
n	(chiefly literary and poetic, archaic) Usually preceded by the: the abode of God or the gods, angels, the souls of deceased people, etc.; heaven; also, powers emanating from heaven.
n	(mathematics, theoretical physics) The set of all lightlike lines (or directions) passing through a given point in space-time.
n	(obsolete, informal, rare) In an art gallery: the upper rows of pictures that cannot easily be seen; also, the place where such pictures are hung.
n	(obsolete) A cloud.
v	(informal) To drink (a beverage) from a container without one's lips touching the container.
v	(informal, dated) To hang (a picture on exhibition) near the top of a wall, where it cannot easily be seen; (by extension) to put (something) in an undesirable place.
v	(slang, dated) To toss (something) upwards; specifically, to flip (a coin).
v	(sports)
v	(obsolete) To raise (the price of an item on auction, or the level of the bids generally) by bidding high.
v	To move quickly, as if by flying; to fly; also, to escape, to flee (especially by airplane).

n	A unisex given name from English.
n	Ellipsis of sky blue. [A vibrant light blue colour, like that of the sky on a fine day.]

n	A brief, sudden period of a certain weather; used primarily in the phrase cold snap.
